'''Silcoon''' ([[List of Japanese Pokémon names|Japanese]]: '''カラサリス''' ''Karasalis'') is a {{type|Bug}} {{OBP|Pokémon|species}} introduced in [[Generation III]].

It [[evolution|evolves]] from {{p|Wurmple}} depending on its [[personality value]], starting at [[level]] 7, and it evolves into {{p|Beautifly}} starting at level 10.

==Biology==
Silcoon is a cocoon-like Pokémon that uses silk to attach itself to tree branches. It is almost completely covered in white silk with only two small holes. A pair of red eyes can be seen through the holes, but they are partially hidden by a rough fringe of silk. The silk forms a hard cocoon that it can use to repel enemy attacks. Dew and rainwater collect on the silk, which provides Silcoon with nourishment. Silcoon lives in {{DL|List of Pokémon by habitat|Forest Pokémon|forests}}, where it conserves energy by moving as little as possible.

==In the anime==
===In the main series===
[[File:May Silcoon.png|thumb|left|220px|Silcoon in the {{pkmn|anime}}]]
====Major appearances====
=====[[May's Silcoon]]=====
In ''[[AG024|A Corphish out of Water]]'', May's Wurmple evolved into a Silcoon alongside Jessie's Wurmple, which evolved into a {{p|Cascoon}}. Both later evolved in ''[[AG028|Seeing is Believing]]'', with Silcoon evolving into May's Beautifly and Cascoon evolving into [[Jessie's Dustox]].

==Trivia==
* Silcoon shares its {{pkmn|category}} with {{p|Metapod}}, {{p|Kakuna}}, and {{p|Cascoon}}. They are all known as the Cocoon Pokémon.
** They also share the same base stat total, learnset, Ability, and EV yield.
*** This ties them as the evolved Pokémon with the lowest base stat total.
* Silcoon and Cascoon have exactly the same type, base stats, moveset, and body style, making them nearly identical.
* Silcoon, along with Cascoon, can be seen without the limb protrusions on its body in the anime, {{g|X and Y}}, {{g|Omega Ruby and Alpha Sapphire}}, and occasionally in {{2v2|HeartGold|SoulSilver}}.
** However, [[James]]' Pokémon trivia cards showed that Silcoon and Cascoon indeed have those limbs.

===Origin===
Silcoon is based on the {{wp|Pupa|chrysalis}} or cocoon stage of a {{wp|butterfly}} or {{wp|moth}}; more specifically, the {{wp|silkworm}} cocoon.

====Name origin====
Silcoon is a combination of ''{{wp|silk}}'' and ''{{wp|Pupa|cocoon}}''.

Karasalis may be a combination of 殻 ''kara'' (shell) and ''{{wp|chrysalis}}''.
